resources.string: Adhell enabled. You are safe now
Adhell is not supported on your device yet.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission (android.permission.BIND_DEVICE_ADMIN). \nTo enable Adhell you need to activate Admin mode for this app. Adhell uses underlying Samsung APIs, and these APIs require Admin privilege.
To block ads Adhell uses Samsung Firewall; to use it please activate Samsung license. It is free.
It seems that your device is not connected to the Internet

To take effect, turn off and turn on Adhell after editing list.

A URL can contain wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com
To define a URL for an individual app, please use this format:
packageName|url
Do you really want to turn off and delete Adhell?
Use it only if you know what DNS is for and what benefits or problems editing could cause. Note that Adhell must be enabled.

To take effect, turn off and turn on Adhell after editing list.

A URL can contain wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com
To define a firewall rule, please use this format:
packageName|ipAddress|port
An example rule for blocking port 53 in Chrome:
com.android.chrome|*|53
DNS addresses have been set. Please turn off and turn on Adhell.
DNS has been restored to defaults. Please turn off and turn on Adhell.

Adhell's standard package is generally sufficient, but you can also add your own links to remotely and locally stored hosts lists.
Adhell can block up to %1$d URLs.

Remote storage: https://adaway.org/hosts.txt
Internal storage: file:///mnt/sdcard/hosts.txt
Your device is running old version of Knox, so this function may be unstable. Sorry
To take effect, turn off and turn on Adhell after restricting apps
To take effect, turn off and turn on Adhell after whitelisting apps
Do you really want to enable all apps?
This will replace your existing backup file if it exists. Are you sure?
Do you really want to restore database? All your setup will be replaced.
